instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.D7050: What is D7050? Diodes between SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL and ground, these data lines allow the battery to communicate with the battery charging chip and the SMC..
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: Customer brought this machine, installed his own cheap crappy battery from Amazon and battery showed X. After replacing with a good battery, the battery showed. I have an orange light, however, it does not charge. Checked all resistors around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> they are all OK, replace <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, same issue. 2 pullups for the battery are 2K, seem fine too. Anything else I should check? SMC reflow maybe?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
Post exact diode mode to ground readings and voltage at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, without battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
Are you sure about these readings?
Is very strange to get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with such big difference between SCL/SDA.

Just in case, remove <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> and check again.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
Yes very sure. The mac is running and working fine, it can see the battery, but just say charging NO, does show charge sign though in the top bar. 

Will check again with what you mentioned.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: Did you test its battery with other board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
I removed <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> and <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, it reads on <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> = 0.771 and <RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR> = 0.485. Put another <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> on the board and no <DIODE>D7050</DIODE>, PPBUS is 12.57. If measure on <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> Pin 1 and 2 both 0.726 (with it removed). With <DIODE>D7050</DIODE> on the board (replaced for a new one) I get 0.522 and 0.518. Readings on <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> and 5187 still the same. Might try an SMC reball? 

Edit there was some corrosion around <DIODE>D7050</DIODE>, could it possible also be a bad battery connector? I guess if I remove the SMC <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> and 87 should read correct if the SMC causes the issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: Yes I am using a new battery, actually tried 2 and its the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
New chinese battery doesn't mean known good.
You must confirm good battery with other board.
Or test the actual board with really known good battery.

"Readings on <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> and 5187 still the same"
<RESISTOR>R5187</RESISTOR>, why???
<RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>/81 are the pull-up resistors for I2C battery bus.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: Batteries are good. Sorry my mistake its <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR> and 5381, getting late here ^^. After remove the SMC, 5380 = 5.19 and <RESISTOR>R5381</RESISTOR> = 5.22 so looks like the SMC causes the issue. Will try reball or replace. Thanks for the help.
